org.title: A Positive Start CIC
org.content:
A Positive Start CIC offers counselling, training and development, providing free and low-cost holistic services to improve mental health, offering concessions for people on low and no incomes, and free for anyone who is furloughed due to Covid. 

Prewear is a project by A Positive Start incorporating our other passion which is sustainability. Prewear is an online charity store, redirecting unwanted fashion from landfill, recycling and rehoming at affordable prices. Funds raised are reinvested to support mental wellbeing in the community.

org.content: The Wheatley Group is Scotland’s biggest social landlord. They run a "Home Comforts" service that helps tenants who need furniture but can’t afford it. It’s a vital service which provides a real lifeline to people struggling to furnish their home.

Merry-go-round is a registered charity and social enterprise supporting local families in three main ways:
A charity shop selling everything baby at low low prices
A partnership programme supplying 100+ agencies in glasgow with free essential children’s goods
Community space to bring families together and reduce isolation

org.title: Transition Stirling
org.content: Transition Stirling is an environmental charity focusing on improving awareness of, and providing a positive local response to, climate change in and around Stirling. Current initiatives include a tool library, repair café events, a wood reuse scheme, educational workshops and climate conversation sessions.

org.title: Stitch the Gap CIC
org.content: We are a start-up Social Enterprise Company who are passionate about bridging the sewing machine skills gap so that this valuable, life-long skill is not lost in our generation. We are passionate about our environment and believe that we can only affect environmental change by equipping people with the skills and knowledge to do this. Our beginner sewing sessions are a small step in the direction to learning how to up-cycle, re-purpose and repair clothes and textiles.

org.title: WASaBED
org.content: Our Social Enterprise recycles retired bedlinen into sustainable handmade bespoke Beach Clean Bags. We will reduce the amount of retired bedlinen going into landfill by bringing it into the circular economy and reusing it for environmental benefits. Retired bedlinen can be made into a range of products including our handmade Beach Clean Bags. We intend to create rural jobs for sewers who can fabricate useful items from retired bedlinen.

org.title: The Edinburgh Remakery
org.content: The Edinburgh Remakery is a social enterprise, community repair hub and second-hand shop based in the Leith area of Edinburgh. Our vision is to create an alternative to a disposable society by making repair education accessible to all, to build a stronger, waste-free community and support vulnerable people within our city.

org.title: ReConnect Glasgow
org.content: ReConnect Glasgow has a vision to support local residents in the East End of Glasgow, as well as embody a reuse culture that helps save the planet. We aim to make sure as many items of furniture as possible are saved from landfill and sell them on through our shop to the people who need it the most. Everything we sell is high quality at bargain prices.

org.title: The GRAB Trust
org.content: The GRAB Trust is a social enterprise that has been providing activities in relation to recycling and environmental  protection in Argyll and Bute for 20 years. We deliver a furniture reuse project in Oban (LORI), a  beach cleaning project and a waste education programme.
